post_title: Pelikan Mobility is building a software-enabled commercial EV leasing solution
title: Pelikan Mobility: Revolutionizing Commercial EV Leasing for Fleet Optimization
post_content:
Unlocking the Electric Revolution for Commercial Fleets

The transition to electric vehicles (EVs) is gaining momentum, but for commercial fleets, the switch can be daunting. Diesel-powered vehicles still dominate the industry due to the perceived high costs and complexities of going electric.

Enter Pelikan Mobility, a French startup that has developed a platform and leasing solution to help commercial fleets navigate this challenge. With a recent €4 million seed round, Pelikan Mobility is poised to revolutionize the way fleets transition to EVs.

Optimizing Fleet Operations with EVs

Pelikan Mobility's software solution empowers fleet managers to optimize their operations with EVs. It goes beyond basic charging and range considerations, taking into account factors like vehicle capacities, parking availability, and even historical data.

This comprehensive approach allows fleets to create tailored optimization scenarios that maximize efficiency and minimize costs. Pelikan Mobility's platform acts as a "digital twin," simulating real-world conditions to generate accurate and long-term scenarios.

Rethinking Leasing for Commercial EVs

The company's platform also unlocks new possibilities in the leasing market. Pelikan Mobility believes that traditional leasing models are outdated for commercial EVs. Short contracts and a focus on resale value are not aligned with the unique needs of fleet managers.

Instead, Pelikan Mobility proposes longer leasing plans that better suit the extended lifespan of EVs. This approach reduces risks associated with resale value and allows fleets to take advantage of the lower operating costs of EVs over the long term.

Making the Switch Easier

Pelikan Mobility's software and leasing solutions are designed to make the transition to EVs more accessible and cost-effective for commercial fleets. By addressing the challenges of charging, range, and financing, the company is empowering fleet managers to embrace the electric revolution.

With a growing customer base and plans to offer leasing services this summer, Pelikan Mobility is poised to become a key player in the electrification of commercial fleets. Its innovative approach is paving the way for a more sustainable and efficient future for the transportation industry.

post_title: GitHub's latest AI tool can automatically fix code vulnerabilities
title: GitHub's AI Autofixes Code Vulnerabilities, Boosting Software Security
post_content:
GitHub's Code-Scanning Autofix: A Game-Changer for Software Security

Imagine a world where bugs are a thing of the past, and security vulnerabilities are detected and fixed before they can wreak havoc. Well, that world may be closer than you think, thanks to GitHub's latest innovation: code-scanning autofix.

This groundbreaking feature harnesses the power of artificial intelligence (AI) to revolutionize the way developers write secure code. By seamlessly integrating with GitHub's Copilot and CodeQL, code-scanning autofix automates the tedious task of vulnerability remediation, freeing developers to focus on innovation.

How It Works

Code-scanning autofix works its magic by leveraging CodeQL, GitHub's semantic analysis engine. This engine scrutinizes code, even before it's executed, to pinpoint potential vulnerabilities. Armed with this knowledge, the feature suggests fixes that can be implemented with minimal effort.

To generate these fixes, GitHub employs OpenAI's GPT-4 model, a cutting-edge AI capable of understanding complex code and suggesting meaningful solutions. The result is a system that can automatically remediate over two-thirds of the vulnerabilities it detects, often without requiring any manual code editing.

Benefits Galore

For developers, code-scanning autofix is a productivity powerhouse. It eliminates the time-consuming task of manually fixing vulnerabilities, allowing them to focus on building great software. Security teams also reap the benefits, as the reduced volume of vulnerabilities frees them to concentrate on strategic security initiatives.

Availability

The code-scanning autofix feature is now available to all GitHub Advanced Security (GHAS) customers. It supports JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, and Python, with plans to expand to other languages in the future.

Conclusion

GitHub's code-scanning autofix is a game-changer for software security. By automating vulnerability remediation, it empowers developers to write secure code with ease, while giving security teams the peace of mind to focus on the bigger picture. As AI continues to revolutionize the software development landscape, we can expect even more innovative solutions that make building secure software a breeze.

post_title: Users say Glassdoor added real names to user profiles without their consent
title: Glassdoor's User Anonymity Breached: Real Names Added Without Consent
post_content:
Glassdoor's Controversial Data Collection: A Breach of Anonymity

Glassdoor, the popular career review website, has sparked controversy over its recent practice of collecting and adding users' real names to their profiles without their consent. This has raised concerns about the potential compromise of user anonymity, which has been a cornerstone of the platform's success.

One user, known as Monica, shared her experience on her blog, revealing that Glassdoor added her name and city to her profile after an email exchange with customer support. Despite never providing her name during the sign-up process, it was allegedly extracted from the "from" line of her email.

Monica expressed concerns that this information could be compromised in a data breach or obtained through legal processes, potentially exposing her identity to employers or law enforcement. She also questioned the accuracy of the data collected, as Glassdoor's website acknowledges its inability to fully verify user identities or the truthfulness of their contributions.

Other Glassdoor users have expressed similar concerns, fearing that their anonymity could be compromised. The platform has long allowed users to sign up anonymously, and the acquisition of Fishbowl, a semi-anonymous professional network, has raised questions about the potential for user verification.

Aaron Mackey, an attorney with the Electronic Frontier Foundation, has voiced concerns about the conflict between Glassdoor's goal of encouraging candid employee reviews and its recent data collection practices. He emphasized the importance of protecting user anonymity in court cases and expressed hope that Glassdoor would continue to defend its users' privacy.

In response to the controversy, Glassdoor has released a boilerplate statement reiterating its commitment to anonymity. However, it has not provided specific answers to questions about how it verifies the accuracy of the collected data or how it can be used or obtained.

The lack of transparency and the potential risks associated with the data collection have left users like Monica with no choice but to delete their accounts. Glassdoor's actions have eroded trust among its users and raised questions about the future of anonymous online reviews.

Users should be aware of the potential risks associated with providing personal information on Glassdoor or any other online platform. It is crucial to carefully consider the privacy implications before sharing sensitive data, especially if anonymity is a priority.

post_title: SpaceX looks to scale astronaut launch capacity with second Florida pad
title: SpaceX Expands Astronaut Launch Capacity with Second Florida Pad
post_content:
SpaceX's Mission to Expand Human Spaceflight

SpaceX, the pioneering space exploration company, is on the cusp of unlocking a new era of human space travel. With the imminent certification of a second launch pad, SpaceX aims to alleviate launch site congestion and significantly increase its capacity for sending astronauts into space.

A Second Launch Pad for Astronaut Missions

Currently, all SpaceX crewed missions have launched from Launch Complex 39A at NASA's Kennedy Space Center. However, the company has been diligently working to upgrade Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the neighboring Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. This second pad will serve as an additional launch site for astronaut missions, expanding SpaceX's capabilities.

To prepare SLC-40 for human spaceflight, SpaceX has installed a crew access arm that enables astronauts to board the Crew Dragon spacecraft. Additionally, a state-of-the-art emergency egress system has been implemented, featuring a long, orange slide that allows the crew to evacuate swiftly in case of an emergency.

Testing and the CRS-30 Mission

As a crucial next step, SpaceX is scheduled to launch the CRS-30 cargo resupply mission tomorrow. This mission is part of a series of routine cargo deliveries to the International Space Station (ISS) that SpaceX conducts for NASA. The CRS-30 launch will serve as a stepping stone towards astronaut launches, as both cargo and crew missions utilize variants of the Dragon spacecraft.

The Future of Human Spaceflight

SpaceX envisions a future where large-scale space travel becomes a reality. The company's ultimate goal is to send hundreds of people into space aboard its Starship spacecraft. The emergency egress system installed at SLC-40 is a testament to this ambition, as it is designed to accommodate larger towers and spaceships.

By expanding its launch capacity and developing innovative technologies, SpaceX is paving the way for a new era of human spaceflight. The certification of SLC-40 and the CRS-30 mission are significant milestones in this extraordinary journey.

post_title: Crypto exchange OKX ceases services in India
title: OKX Withdraws from India Amid Regulatory Crackdown
post_content:
Cryptocurrency Exchange OKX Exits India

In a recent move, OKX, a prominent cryptocurrency exchange, has announced its withdrawal from the Indian market. The decision, communicated via email to its Indian customers, requires them to withdraw their funds by the end of April.

Reasons Behind the Exit

OKX's departure stems from the Indian government's crackdown on cryptocurrency exchanges operating illegally within its borders. The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU), a government agency, has identified several exchanges, including Binance, Kraken, Huobi, and Gate.io, as being non-compliant with Indian regulations. While OKX was not explicitly named in the FIU's statement, the exchange has cited "local regulations" as the reason for its exit.

Impact on Indian Crypto Traders

OKX's withdrawal creates a significant challenge for Indian crypto traders who have been using the platform. They are now required to close all active margin positions and withdraw their funds by April 30th. This move is likely to cause inconvenience and disruption for many traders.

Regulatory Landscape in India

The Indian government has been taking a cautious approach towards cryptocurrencies. In March 2022, it brought cryptocurrencies under the ambit of anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing regulations. While some local exchanges have complied with these regulations, many international exchanges, including OKX, have not.

Taxation and Compliance

India has also introduced a 30% tax on cryptocurrency gains and a 1% deduction on each transaction. This has led some Indian traders to seek refuge on global platforms that do not have rigorous know-your-customer (KYC) verification processes. However, this practice has come under scrutiny from the Indian government, which is seeking to enforce compliance with its regulations.

Conclusion

OKX's exit from India is a reminder of the evolving regulatory landscape surrounding cryptocurrencies. As governments worldwide grapple with the potential risks and benefits of digital assets, it is likely that we will see further regulatory actions in the future. Indian traders are advised to stay informed about the latest regulations and to use only compliant platforms for their cryptocurrency transactions.

The fund's investment focus aligns with NATO's priorities in areas such as space, AI, and cybersecurity. However, OTB Ventures emphasizes that its investments are not in weapons but rather in technologies with civilian applications that can also benefit the defense sector.

post_title: EU signals doubts over legality of Meta's privacy fee
title: EU Questions Legality of Meta's Privacy Fee
post_content:
Meta's Controversial Privacy Fee Under Scrutiny by EU

The European Union (EU) has raised concerns about Meta's "consent or pay" tactic, which forces users in the region to either pay a monthly subscription or agree to data tracking to use Facebook and Instagram.

EU's Concerns

EU Competition Chief Margrethe Vestager has questioned the legitimacy of Meta's privacy fee, stating that there are alternative ways to monetize services without relying on targeted advertising based on user data. She emphasized the need for Meta to comply with the Digital Markets Act (DMA), which aims to curb the dominance of tech giants and promote fair competition.

Vestager also expressed concern about Apple's recently announced fee structure, which could potentially undermine the benefits of the DMA. The EU is monitoring these developments closely to ensure that tech companies do not circumvent the intended impact of the new regulations.

DMA and DSA Compliance

Meta is designated as a "gatekeeper" under the DMA, which imposes restrictions on the use of personal data for advertising. The Digital Services Act (DSA) also requires platforms to obtain consent for ads processing.

The EU has sent a formal request for information (RFI) to Meta regarding its compliance with the DSA. The Commission is assessing whether Meta's subscription option violates the DSA's transparency and risk assessment requirements.

Consumer Protection Concerns

Consumer protection groups have filed complaints against Meta, arguing that the privacy fee breaches EU consumer protection and privacy laws. They claim that the pricing is disproportionate to the value Meta derives per user and that it manipulates users through economic coercion.

Meta maintains that its consent paywall is compliant with EU laws, but it has reportedly offered to lower the subscription cost in discussions with privacy regulators.

EU's Enforcement Options

The EU has a range of enforcement options available, including penalties of up to 10% of global annual turnover for DMA violations. The Commission has indicated that it will not hesitate to take action against Meta if it finds noncompliance.

Conclusion

The EU's scrutiny of Meta's privacy fee signals a growing concern about tech companies' attempts to circumvent regulations and maintain their dominant positions. The EU is committed to protecting consumer rights, promoting fair competition, and ensuring that users have genuine choices when it comes to their data privacy.

Meta faces significant pressure to comply with EU laws and regulations. The outcome of the EU's investigations will have implications for the company's business model and the future of data privacy in the digital era.

post_title: Mermaid Chart, a Markdown-like tool for creating diagrams, raises $7.5M
title: Mermaid Chart: Open-Source Diagramming Tool Secures $7.5M Funding
post_content:
Mermaid Chart: Empowering Visual Communication for All

In the realm of diagramming and charting, Mermaid has emerged as a formidable open-source tool, capturing the hearts of developers worldwide. Its Markdown-like language has made it a breeze to create visually appealing diagrams, revolutionizing the way we communicate complex information.

The Genesis of Mermaid: A Lost File and a Creative Spark

The story of Mermaid's inception is both amusing and relatable. Founder Knut Sveidqvist found himself grappling with a lost Microsoft Visio file, forcing him to painstakingly redraw everything. Amidst his frustration, an idea sparked: "There had to be a better way."

Inspired by the rising popularity of Markdown, Sveidqvist envisioned a text-based approach to diagramming. That evening, amidst the laughter of his children watching "The Little Mermaid," the project was born.

From Flowcharts to a Community-Driven Ecosystem

Initially focused on flowcharts, Mermaid quickly evolved to encompass a wide range of diagram types. The open-source community embraced the tool, contributing their own ideas and enhancements. Today, Mermaid boasts an impressive 4 million users, showcasing its widespread adoption.

The Rise of Mermaid Chart: Commercializing an Open-Source Success

Recognizing Mermaid's potential, Open Core Ventures (OCV), led by GitLab founder Sid Sijbrandij, partnered with serial entrepreneur Andrew Firestone to establish Mermaid Chart. This venture aims to build hosted services around the open-source project, making it accessible to a broader audience.

Expanding the Horizon: Beyond Diagramming

While Mermaid Chart remains committed to enhancing its diagramming capabilities, its vision extends far beyond the likes of Lucidchart and Miro. The company aspires to challenge workflow automation giants such as ServiceNow, leveraging Mermaid's potential as a comprehensive knowledge base.

Lowering the Barrier to Entry: Visual Editor and AI Assistance

Despite its text-based nature, Mermaid Chart recognizes the importance of accessibility. To cater to users who prefer a more visual approach, the team has introduced an optional visual editor.

Moreover, Mermaid has harnessed AI to further simplify the diagramming process. Users can now create charts through a chat-like interface, and paying subscribers can even rely on AI to correct syntax errors.

The Future of Mermaid Chart: Empowering Business Users

As Mermaid Chart continues to grow, its focus remains on expanding its user base and empowering non-technical users with the tools they need to communicate visually. By leveraging AI and building a comprehensive knowledge base, Mermaid Chart aims to revolutionize the way businesses document and automate their processes.

Conclusion

Mermaid Chart's journey from an open-source project to a promising commercial venture is a testament to the power of innovation and community collaboration. As the company continues to evolve, it holds the potential to transform the way we visualize and manage information, empowering businesses and individuals alike to unlock new levels of productivity and understanding.

post_title: Candela's electric ferries multiply as the startup lines up $25M in new funding
title: Candela's Electric Ferries Soar with $25M Funding
post_content:
Electric Boats Take Flight with Candela's $25 Million Funding

Candela, the Swedish electric boat manufacturer, is making waves in the industry with its innovative designs and recent funding success. The company has secured $25 million in new funding, led by boating giant Groupe Beneteau, to accelerate its mission of revolutionizing sustainable boating.

From Small Beginnings to Commercial Deployment

Candela's journey began with the development of smaller electric boats, such as the C-7 and C-8, which have gained popularity for their efficiency and sleek design. The company has now expanded its portfolio to include larger vessels, culminating in the P-12 ferry, capable of transporting up to 30 passengers.

This milestone was recently celebrated with the first commercial deployment of the P-12 in New Zealand's Lake Manapōuri. The ferry will transport staff to the country's largest hydroelectric power station, replacing diesel-powered vehicles and reducing emissions by an estimated 240 tons annually.

Global Ambitions and Industry Partnerships

Candela's success has attracted the attention of Groupe Beneteau, a century-old boating company renowned for its global reach. This investment signals the growing recognition of electric boats as the future of the industry.

The collaboration between Candela and Groupe Beneteau aligns with the latter's commitment to sustainability and innovation. CEO Bruno Thivoyon emphasizes the importance of investing in "scaling up innovative solutions for more sustainable boating."

Hydrofoils for Efficiency and Speed

Candela's boats utilize hydrofoils and electric engines to achieve remarkable energy efficiency. Once a certain speed is reached, the hydrofoils lift the hull out of the water, reducing drag and enabling higher speeds with less energy consumption.

This technology requires a sophisticated autopilot system for stability, but the overall advantages outweigh the challenges. Candela's vessels offer a smooth and quiet ride, making them ideal for passenger transport and recreational boating.

Competition and Market Potential

Candela is not alone in the pursuit of electric boat technology. Navier and Zin Boats are also vying for a share of the market, targeting coastal communities with their energy-efficient and environmentally friendly vessels.

The growing demand for sustainable transportation options, combined with the technological advancements in electric boat design, is creating a promising future for this industry.

Conclusion

Candela's $25 million funding and the commercial deployment of its P-12 ferry mark a significant step forward in the electrification of boating. With its innovative technology, global ambitions, and industry partnerships, Candela is poised to lead the charge towards a more sustainable and efficient future on the water.

title: Apex Legends Hacker Claims 'Fun' Motive in Tournament Hacks
post_content:
Apex Legends Hacking Scandal: A Tale of Cheating, Controversy, and Security Woes

The world of competitive gaming was thrown into chaos recently when a hacking incident rocked the Apex Legends Global Series tournament. During a live-streamed match, two prominent players found themselves compromised midgame, with cheats injected into their gameplay.

The incident sparked outrage among the Apex Legends community, with accusations flying about the game's security and the potential for widespread cheating. The tournament organizers were forced to postpone the event indefinitely, citing concerns over competitive integrity.

The hacker, known as Destroyer2009, claimed responsibility for the hacks, stating that he did it "just for fun" and to highlight a vulnerability in the game. He declined to provide specific details about the exploit he used, but insisted that it did not involve accessing the players' computers directly.

Destroyer2009's actions ignited a debate about the ethics of hacking and the responsibility of game developers to address security flaws. He argued that his intentions were not malicious and that he wanted to force Respawn, the game's developer, to fix the vulnerability. However, some players expressed concerns about the potential for more sinister uses of such exploits.

Respawn acknowledged the incident and released a brief statement, assuring players that they were taking steps to address the security concerns. However, they did not provide any details about the specific measures being implemented.

The Apex Legends hacking scandal has raised questions about the security of online gaming and the need for stronger anti-cheat measures. Easy Anti-Cheat, the developers of the anti-cheat engine used in the game, denied that there was a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability being exploited. However, the lack of public evidence to support this claim has left some players skeptical.

Despite the attention his actions garnered, Destroyer2009 downplayed the threat, claiming that it was unlikely that others would be able to replicate his exploit before it was patched. However, the incident has served as a wake-up call for the gaming industry, highlighting the importance of continuous security improvements and the need for players to be vigilant against potential threats.

As the investigation continues, the Apex Legends community awaits further updates from Respawn and the anti-cheat developers. The outcome of this scandal will have implications for the future of competitive gaming and the ongoing battle against cheating in online multiplayer environments.
